results.title: Squizzy Taylor
results.creator_credit: Roger Simpson, Roger Le Mesurier and Kevin Dobson
results.brief_description: Set in the 1920’s, in Melbourne, and covering the life and experiences of the enterprising and notorious criminal Squizzy Taylor. Stars Jackie Weaver, Alan Cassell and David Atkins.

results.title: Squirrel on my shoulder and Brockside
results.brief_description: Squirrel on my shoulder, narrated by Sir David Attenborough, tells the story of Sammy, an orphaned baby Grey Squirrel which was raised by a cat as one of her kittens, and eventually released back into the wild. “Brockside”, presented by Simon King, looks at the tenuous life of the urban Badger, living off its human neighbours as urban devlopment enchroaches on the lands they have traditionally occupied.
results.description: Squirrel on my shoulder, narrated by Sir David Attenborough, tells the story of Sammy, an orphaned baby Grey Squirrel which was raised by a cat as one of her kittens, and eventually released back into the wild. “Brockside”, presented by Simon King, looks at the tenuous life of the urban Badger, living off its human neighbours as urban devlopment enchroaches on the lands they have traditionally occupied.

results.title: Squinka
results.brief_description: A film about the power a Squinka medallion has over a group of young people and how it becomes a mnemonic for the group as they search for jobs. After some argument they exchange their individual interpretations of what Squinka means. They discuss how Squinka can be used to guide individual careers.

results.title: Squeak the squirrel
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Lester F. Beck
results.brief_description: A baby squirrel is used in experiments to show how animals learn. He soon learns not to be afraid of people, finds how to get nuts out of glass tubes and out of boxes. He stuffs them in his cheek pouches and scurries off to hoard them in his nest.

results.title: Squash the Khan's way
results.brief_description: A series of easy to follow routines appropriate to players of all standards. The routines are performed from the front, back, side and from above, giving a unique opportunity to study how to play the shots and follow the drills.

results.title: Squash Clinic
results.brief_description: Jahangir Khan - world squash champion and his coach Rahmat Khan feature in this comprehensive instructional video on squash technique. The player standard at which the video is aimed commences with beginners, includes the intermediate level and finishes with advanced instruction.

results.title: Squarejohns
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Graham Parker and Bill Davies
results.brief_description: Follows the adjustment of two paroled prisoners as observed by their parole officer. One of the men, aging and tired, seems resigned to the “square” life of “the street.” He seems more in need of protection than supervision. The other is younger, more demanding of life and so more tempted. How the parole officer works to aid both through the parole period is convincingly shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Graham Parker and Bill Davies

results.title: Square pegs, round holes (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Helps young people understand individualism and the pressures of conformity by presenting an animated story about a cube who learns from its disappointments in trying to fit into round holes that being different is just as good as being the same.
